verses.verse: Samson Dies with the Philistines Now the lords of the Philistines gathered together to offer a great sacrifice to (1 Sam. 5:2) Dagon their god, and to rejoice. And they said: “Our god has delivered into our hands Samson our enemy!”
When the people saw him, they (Dan. 5:4) praised their god; for they said: “Our god has delivered into our hands our enemy, The destroyer of our land, And the one who multiplied our dead.”

So it happened, when their hearts were (Judg. 9:27) merry, that they said, “Call for Samson, that he may perform for us.” So they called for Samson from the prison, and he performed for them. And they stationed him between the pillars.
Then Samson said to the lad who held him by the hand, “Let me feel the pillars which support the temple, so that I can lean on them.”
Now the temple was full of men and women. All the lords of the Philistines were there—about three thousand men and women on the (Deut. 22:8) roof watching while Samson performed.

Then Samson called to the LORD, saying, “O Lord GOD, (Jer. 15:15) remember me, I pray! Strengthen me, I pray, just this once, O God, that I may with one blow take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes!”
And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars which supported the temple, and he braced himself against them, one on his right and the other on his left.

Then Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines!” And he pushed with all his might, and the temple fell on the lords and all the people who were in it. So the dead that he killed at his death were more than he had killed in his life.

And his brothers and all his father’s household came down and took him, and brought him up and (Judg. 13:25) buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of his father Manoah. He had judged Israel (Judg. 15:20) twenty years.
Micah’s Idolatry Now there was a man from the mountains of Ephraim, whose name was (Judg. 18:2) Micah.

And he said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you, and on which you (Lev. 5:1) put a curse, even saying it in my ears—here is the silver with me; I took it.” And his mother said, (Gen. 14:19) “May you be blessed by the LORD, my son!”

So when he had returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, his mother said, “I had wholly dedicated the silver from my hand to the LORD for my son, to (Ex. 20:4, 23; 34:17; Lev. 19:4) make a carved image and a molded image; now therefore, I will return it to you.”

Thus he returned the silver to his mother. Then his mother (Is. 46:6) took two hundred shekels of silver and gave them to the silversmith, and he made it into a carved image and a molded image; and they were in the house of Micah.
